IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Two year private post secondary institution for students with learning disabilities such as dyslexia, ADD and ADHA providing educational services leading to an Associates degree in Arts or Business degree.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Two year private post secondary institute for students with learning disabilities such as dyslexia, ADD and ADHD providing educatinal services leading to an Associates in Arts or business degree.
IRS990.Description: Provide higher education to students under a college degree program

Activity2.Description: College Transitions Prgram - Providing educational assistance to improve learning skills to students transitioning to a college

Activity3.Description: Providing educational assistance to improve learning skills to high school students.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: To Provide scholarships to Landmark students
Write off of pledge bad debts
Fund raising expenses 12,4095. Laptop Inventory cost of good sold 378,494. Bookstore cost of Goods sold 419,976.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The Racially nondiscriminatory policy is published in catalogues, brochures, and continuing education literature
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The college received Title 4 funding from the US Department of Education

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: The college manages Federal Title 4 grant funds in accordance with Title 4 regulations. The college undergoes an annual A-133 audit to monitor the use of the funds.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: How Members elect governing board - Landmark college is governed by a Board of Trustees. The election of a trustee requires an affirmative vote by a majority of trustees in office at the time of the vote. A vacancy in the Board of trustees can be filled at any regular or special meeting of the Board of trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Review process - Form 990 reviewed at board of trustee meeting prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The college does an annual review of comparable institutions salary per their 990 reports and provides this information to the audit committee of the colleges board of trustees who then determine the compensation.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Other Organizations documents publically available - Most policies are available from the college website. Policies not on the website and finacial statements can be obtained through a request to the college business office.
